verbose_text: Therefore, we hypothesized that overexpression of the IC (1-111) wild-type fragment should disrupt Golgi morphology as it is capable of pyrophosphorylation and dynactin binding, whereas the S51A mutant, which cannot be pyrophosphorylated, should not exhibit Golgi fragmentation due to its reduced binding to p150 Glued.
evidence: overexpression of the IC(1-111) wild-type fragment
